pullrequest.title: Fix for binary STL file parsing on Windows

content.raw:
ok, I think we have test coverage for this.

1. the [concave_mesh](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/4004fbd7deede758c0ca0fbc7c906e62b0a808a4/test/integration/concave_mesh.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#concave_mesh.cc-89) test loads the [cordless_drill model](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/9ce1c9cfbc7c30eee6c65455d06e602e32185141/cordless_drill/model.sdf?fileviewer=file-view-default#model.sdf-21) via the [concave_mesh_test world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/4004fbd7deede758c0ca0fbc7c906e62b0a808a4/test/worlds/concave_mesh_test.world?fileviewer=file-view-default#concave_mesh_test.world-7).

2. the [cordless_drill model](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/9ce1c9cfbc7c30eee6c65455d06e602e32185141/cordless_drill/model.sdf?fileviewer=file-view-default#model.sdf-21) uses an [STL mesh](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/9ce1c9cfbc7c30eee6c65455d06e602e32185141/cordless_drill/meshes/cordless_drill.stl?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) for its collision shape

3. the test uses a ray sensor to [verify that the collision geometry is loaded properly](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/4004fbd7deede758c0ca0fbc7c906e62b0a808a4/test/integration/concave_mesh.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#concave_mesh.cc-102)

and that test passed:

* [linux](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/58/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_ConcaveMeshTest/)
* [homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/516/testReport/(root)/PhysicsEngines_ConcaveMeshTest/)
content.html:
ok, I think we have test coverage for this.

  1. the concave_mesh test loads the cordless_drill model via the concave_mesh_test world.

  2. the cordless_drill model uses an STL mesh for its collision shape

  3. the test uses a ray sensor to verify that the collision geometry is loaded properly

and that test passed:

  • linux
  • homebrew
